triageFlags.title: Credit Score in Sub-Prime Tier
triageFlags.description: The applicant's credit score places them in the 'Sub-Prime' tier, requiring stricter lending criteria.
triageFlags.recommendation: Proceed with caution and ensure all other criteria are strictly met.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, a credit score of 575 falls into the 'Sub-Prime' tier, which necessitates additional scrutiny and adherence to stricter lending criteria.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Close to Maximum Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's Debt-to-Income ratio is close to the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify all income and expense details to ensure the DTI calculation is accurate.
triageFlags.reasoning: The policy specifies a maximum DTI of 35% for 'Sub-Prime' tier applicants. The current DTI of 31.43% is within this limit but close enough to warrant careful verification of affordability.

content.reasoning: The applicant's credit score places them in the 'Sub-Prime' tier, necessitating stricter lending criteria. The Debt-to-Income ratio is within the allowable range but close to the limit, indicating potential affordability concerns. The vehicle and loan structure meet policy requirements, mitigating some risk.
